III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation About a month ago, during admission contraband search, youth
was asked to strip to nude and spin around for staff completing
the search.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 04/14/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
I spoke with DHHS Specialist on 04/14/2023, who was on her way
to the facility where Youth A is currently placed at in Kalamazoo. It
was arranged that DHHS Specialist would call Consultant, so
Consultant could participate in the interview via telephone.
I interviewed Youth A via telephone on 04/14/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist, who was on site. Youth A
confirmed that she was previously placed at Children’s Village for
approximately two months. Youth A could not remember the exact
date of her placement admission, she thinks it was 01/28/23,
around 10pm. There where two staff members on the unit. Staff 2
was in the hallway going through her clothes and the other Staff 1
was doing her intake. Staff 1 had her strip naked in the bathroom
before her shower. She said Staff 1 took all her personal
belongings including her eyeglasses. She said Staff 1 made her
lift her breast and squat while totally naked. Youth A said the next
day she did tell her therapist and the supervisor at Mandy’s Place
about being strip searched. Youth A could not recall if she told her
Foster Care Worker about being strip searched.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) on 04/17/2023
via telephone. FCW said Youth A was placed at Children’s Village
on 02/09/2023 and she was meeting with Youth A weekly while at
Children’s Village. Youth A never reported being strip search or
expressed any concerns regarding staff at Children’s Village.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 04/17/2023 and
reported no further information.
2

DCWL Consultant 2 interviewed Youth A at her current placement
on 04/17/2023. Youth A reported being at Children’s Village prior
to her placement at Let’s Talk About It (current placement). Youth
A said she believes she had told her Foster Care Worker about
being strip searched but could not be sure. Youth A said she told
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 the following day about being strip
search and was told that they will look into it.
I interviewed Administrator at the facility on 04/19/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Administrator reported Youth
A was placed at Mandy’s Place on 02/09/2023 in the evening, so
Staff 1 and Staff 2 handled her intake and completed the
assessment. He said resident assessments are usually completed
by the nurse, but for after-hours intakes the staff complete the
resident assessment. The staff member would inspect the
resident’s legs, arms, hands, legs, stomach, back, and complete
the body chart. The residents are not asked to strip naked.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility on 04/19/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 has worked at
the facility for 27 years. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A had told
staff about not being happy with the way staff handled her intake,
so he met with Youth A and discussed the intake protocol. Youth
A did not tell him that she was strip search, but she didn’t like the
way staff handled her intake. Supervisor 1 said Youth A did not go
into details on what specifically she did not like about the search.
He reported during regular business hours the nurse will do the
intake and the assessment of the youth's body to check for marks
or bruises. He reported if a youth comes after hours a staff
member will do the intake and body chart. He reported the girls do
not take off their bras or underwear during the assessment. He
said the body search is to take place in the bathroom and they
must shower before going to their unit. There are cameras in the
hallway, but not in the bathroom/shower area. He said there are
no previous complaints regarding staff strip searching youths
during intake.
I interviewed Therapist at the facility on 04/19/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Therapist has been working at
the facility for 3 years. Therapist reported Youth A never disclosed
or complained to her directly. Therapist said she met with Youth A
weekly and Youth A’s mood was up and down, but she never
reported to her that she was strip search.
3

I interviewed Supervisor 2 at the facility on 04/19/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 2 has been
working at the facility for 22 years. Supervisor 2 reported that
Youth A did not complain to him directly about the intake search,
but he heard about it from the administrator a week after her
placement. He spoke with Youth A and explained about the “safe
search protocol” that is completed during the intake process. He
said Youth A told him she had to get “naked” for her intake search
but did not provide any other detail. Supervisor 2 said he spoke
with Staff 1 and Staff 1 denied that Youth A was naked when she
completed the assessment. He said Youth A never said she had
to squat or lift her breast up during her intake search.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 04/19/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth B reported she has been at
Children’s Village since 02/01/2023. Youth B said she came to the
facility in the evening, she had to check in, give her clothing to the
staff to do inventory, complete a body assessment, shower and
brush her teeth. She said during her body assessment she lifted
her sweater for staff to check her arms, stomach, and back. She
was wearing joggers and lifted the legs up for staff to check her
legs and feet. She denied staff asked her to strip naked. Youth B
said she was handed fresh clothes and towel to shower after she
completed her assessment. Youth B denied staff came into the
bathroom or were present while she showered and got dressed.
She denied hearing any youth complain about staff strip searching
them. Youth B did not express any concerns regarding staff or the
facility.
I interviewed Staff 1 at her home on 04/24/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a direct care worker, has been
working at the facility for 5 years, and has never had any
disciplinary action. Staff 1 reported she followed the safety search
protocol when she completed the assessment on Youth A. She
said she had Youth A pull her sleeves up, lift her sweater to show
her back and stomach area, and pull her pants legs up. She
denied asking Youth A to lift her breast or squat and reported she
never saw Youth A naked. Staff 1 reported Youth A was upset
during her intake because they had to take her cell phone. She
said Youth A had two cell phones and did not want to hand over
her cell phones. This was the only thing that upset Youth A during
her intake.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 05/08/2023. Staff 2 is a
direct care worker and has been working at the facility for 6
months. Staff 2 recalled the intake assessment involving Youth A
4

on 02/09/2023. Staff 2 was doing Youth A’s clothing inventory,
while Staff 1 was doing the safety search assessment for Youth A.
Staff 2 said she saw Youth A go to the bathroom/shower and saw
Staff 1 hand Youth A her towels. She denied seeing Youth A strip
naked or hear Staff 1 tell Youth A to squat or lift her breast. Staff 2
said Youth A was upset during her intake, because Staff 1 had to
take away her cell phone.
DHHS Specialist
A predisposition conference call held with DHHS Specialist on
05/10/2023 resulted in no findings.
Video Reviewed:
The video date is 02/09/23 at 11:54pm. Video had no audio. The
video is of a hallway there is one door to the bathroom/ showers,
one door to the unit, and at the end of the hallway is the
supervisor’s office. Staff 1 is seen standing next to the bathroom
door after, Youth A enters the bathroom/shower fully clothed, Staff
1 hands Youth A clothes and a towel, Staff 2 is standing a few feet
away from Staff 1 doing inventory on Youth A clothing. Staff 1 is
standing in the hallway next to the bathroom door from 11:55 to
11:58 pm and appears to be talking to Youth A. Staff 1 walks
away from the bathroom door area, at 12:05 am Youth A walks
out of the bathroom fully dressed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Residential Assessment: Youth A assessment completed
on 02/10/23. Body diagram: heel small birth mark. Head
diagram: red mark on back of left side of neck, 1x piercing
on each ear and a scar on her forehead.
• Facility policy Safety Search -Mandy’s Place. Resident
intake body chart after nurse hours to be completed by
Children’s Village staff members. At the time of admission,
a same sex staff member will inspect the resident legs,
arms, hands, feet, face, neck, back, and stomach, and
complete a body chart that documents any marks or
bruises. The resident will not be asked to remove their
underwear or bra and will be allowed to lift their shirt for
inspection of the back and stomach. Following the
completion of the body chart, the staff member will request
that the resident take a shower.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 -no disciplinary action.
• Youth A’s well child exam completed by Nurse 1 on
02/14/2023. Exam was normal and Youth A did not report
concerns or issues.
5

Analysis There is insufficient evidence that Youth A was strip search by Staff
1. Based on interviews with Staff, Supervisors, documentation, and
video, Staff 1 followed the facility’s policy regarding safety search
assessment completed on Youth A during her intake.
Technical Assistance:
Facility was advised that after hour safety search assessment
should document how staff completed the search assessment.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
